result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Racquel R. Krueger

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.

(Cases 22CM608, 22CM239 are called at 10:18 AM) Defendant Racquel R. Krueger in court with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests these cases be forwarded to assigned branch- enters Not Guilty pleas to all cases and charges. Court receives Not Guilty pleas. Branch 3 for further scheduling.

9:56 AM Cases called: 22CM239 & 22CM608. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Racquel R. Krueger in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Racquel R. Krueger. Attorney Rivard does not have an offer from the State.
Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with A.T.
Comply with DHS directives.

(11:13 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Racquel R. Krueger in court without counsel.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint.
Defendant updates address and phone number with the Court.
State notes the defendant has an open pending case and requests both cases be scheduled for same date and time.
Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
